name: BTDFDeploy-Arti
description: Deployment Framework for BizTalk btdfproj project target: Deploy(All Artifacts)
author: Mikael Bohlin Liljekvist

inputs.name: Environment
inputs.label: Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: The environment-specific 'Settings file name:' as shown in your SettingsFileGenerator.xml.  If the .xml extension is excluded, '_settings.xml' will be appended for backwards compatibility.  Leave blank to skip EnvironmentSettings export.

inputs.name: Destination
inputs.label: Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the directory where the product is installed. EX: C:\Program Files (x86)

inputs.name: RunOrder
inputs.label: Order in which to run the Deploy
inputs.helpMarkDown: In which order to run applications. String will match if it exists in name of artifact. Seperated by "," (No spaces!). Runs left to right. Case sensetive.

inputs.name: ClusterName
inputs.label: Name of cluster running biztalk instances
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the cluster controlling bztalk. (Leave empty if target is not in cluster and set ShouldRunOnLastNode to true. This will make it run.)

inputs.name: ShouldRunOnLastNode
inputs.label: Should run on last node
inputs.helpMarkDown: Should this run on the last node? (False = Run on all inactive nodes in cluster, True = Run on all nodes with a active biztalk service.)

inputs.name: BTDeployMgmtDB
inputs.label: Deploy Mgmt DB
inputs.helpMarkDown: Boolean DeployBizTalkMgmtDB MSBuild property setting used when building the BTDF project (*.btdfproj).

inputs.name: SkipUndeploy
inputs.label: Skip Undeploy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Boolean SkipUndeploy MSBuild property setting used when building the BTDF project (*.btdfproj).  A dedicated Undeploy task is recommended over setting Skip Undeploy to false.  But, the option is here if desired.
